name: What The Sea Sent To Me ~ Laurence Fuller x Richard Nadler

metadata.name: What The Sea Sent To Me #1/32
metadata.description:
Art & Poetry collaboration w/ Laurence Fuller & Richard Nadler

The vast abyss carried away by the waves,
Touching the forbidden void at the end of days.
I lost my grip, climbing sandstone caverns,
I fell head first into an endless lamentation.
Sea lions danced,
Fluctuations of jelly fish in a swarm,
Death itself a passenger in the garden of salt.
Love me the only way that you can,
A rusted shipwreck of a man,
Weeds tangled round the splinters of an emotion, 
But in the deck a pulsating gemstone,
That all the sea and all its entities,
Blossoming anemones, nudibranchs,
Did gather to see what the sea had sent to me. 
Poetry by Laurence Fuller, 2023

AI & Animation by Laurence Fuller & Richard Nadler
Music & Sound by Laurence Fuller
Poetry & Performance by Laurence Fuller
